Name: Dutch Breakfast Cocktail
Ingredients: 7.5 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Coupe glass .
Prepare garnish of orange zest twist.
EXPRESS orange zest twist over the cocktail and use as garnish.
Review: A tasty, aromatic, almost creamy alternative to a fry-up.
History: Adapted from a recipe created in 2002 by Alex Kammerling, London, England.
Nutrition: One serving of Dutch Breakfast Cocktail contains 258 calories
